<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_try_alloc:
```c
void *
MHD_pool_try_alloc (struct MemoryPool *pool,
                    size_t size,
                    size_t *required_bytes)
{
  void *ret;
  size_t asize;

  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->pos == ROUND_TO_ALIGN (pool->pos));
  asize = ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE (size);
  if ( (0 == asize) && (0 != size) )
  { /* size is too close to SIZE_MAX, very unlikely */
    *required_bytes = SIZE_MAX;
    return NULL;
  }
  if (asize > pool->end - pool->pos)
  {
    mhd_assert ((pool->end - pool->pos) == \
                ROUND_TO_ALIGN (pool->end - pool->pos));
    if (asize <= pool->end)
      *required_bytes = asize - (pool->end - pool->pos);
    else
      *required_bytes = SIZE_MAX;
    return NULL;
  }
  *required_bytes = 0;
  ret = &pool->memory[pool->end - asize];
  pool->end -= asize;
  _MHD_UNPOISON_MEMORY (ret, size);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
asize = ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE (size);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call to ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE(size) does not show any direct or indirect call to MHD_pool_try_alloc. ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE is typically a macro or helper that performs alignment arithmetic (or calls other non‑recursive helpers); therefore this fragment does not introduce recursion and does not violate Rule 17.2. (Only if ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE were implemented as a function that — directly or via other calls — invoked MHD_pool_try_alloc would Rule 17.2 be violated, but there is no evidence of that in the provided code.)
